text: William Peter MacGregor (1853 - 24 February 1899) was a Scottish-born Australian politician. His parents were Andrew MacGregor and Mary Dove, and he arrived in New South Wales around 1878, settling in Broken Hill. He ran a station near Silverton, and became involved in local mining as a shareholder and businessman. In 1885 he was elected to the New South Wales Legislative Assembly as the member for Wentworth. He was re-elected in 1887, but resigned later that year. MacGregor died in East Melbourne in 1899. ==References== Category:1853 births Category:1899 deaths Category:Members of the New South Wales Legislative Assembly Category:Free Trade Party politicians Category:19th-century Australian politicians
title: William MacGregor (Australian politician)
